title: Applied GIS for Landscape Ecology
text:
Aims
In this course you will get an introductory overview of typical methods of geoinformatics in the field of landscape ecology. We will use QGIS as a software, however, once you know one GIS system, you should be able to transfer your skills beyond GIS if desired/required.
After this course you should… * be familiar with the common terminology and concepts in geospatial data analysis * know your toolbox of common GIS functions and be able to select and use the suitable GIS functions for your tasks * able to create, manipulate, analyze and visualize vector and raster data (in QGIS) * most importantly be able to independently use GIS beyond the example tasks of this course!

title: Applied GIS for Landscape Ecology

Course structure and study tasks
You should, to large parts, be able to use the material provided on these pages for self study. However, if you are a student of Landscape ecology in Münster, we highly recommend to take advantage of the in-person course programme. See o find out when this course is offered.
